Key Match Events: Tarik Skubal pitched six solid innings, allowing one run on four hits, with no walks and six strikeouts.
Riley Greene made a leaping catch at the left-field fence to potentially change the game's outcome.
Spencer Torkelson hit a two-run, two-out double in the fourth inning, accounting for Detroit's offense.
Post-Match Reflections: Tarik Skubal felt like he could've done better, citing misfires and lack of first-pitch strikes.
Skubal joked about catching a comebacker with his hand instead of his glove.
Spencer Torkelson reflected on the loss, stating that all losses suck, but they'll come back tomorrow ready to go.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Detroit fell 3 1/2 games behind Minnesota in the AL Wild Card chase with 15 games to play.
The Tigers' next nine games come against the Orioles and Royals.
